_instructions: AI dịch nhưng CẦN REVIEW. Check kỹ dev terms và UI length.

entries.original:
[EN] A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its CSS support for CSS custom properties (variables), at-rules, pseudo-classes, and pseudo-elements you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.
[EN] By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.
[EN] Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.
[EN] Invalid number of parameters.
[EN] Do not use `width` or `height` when using `padding` or `border`.
[EN] When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.
[EN] Do not use duplicate style definitions.
[EN] Do not use empty rulesets.
[EN] Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.
[EN] `@font-face` rule must define `src` and `font-family` properties.
[EN] Hex colors must consist of 3, 4, 6 or 8 hex numbers.
[EN] Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.
[EN] IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.
[EN] Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.
[EN] Import statements do not load in parallel.
[EN] Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.
[EN] The universal selector (`*`) is known to be slow.
[EN] Unknown at-rule.
[EN] Unknown property.
[EN] A list of properties that are not validated against the `unknownProperties` rule.
[EN] Unknown vendor specific property.
[EN] When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.
[EN] No unit for zero needed.
[EN] Traces the communication between VS Code and the CSS language server.
[EN] Enables or disables all validations.
[EN] Show property and value documentation in CSS hovers.
[EN] Show references to MDN in CSS hovers.
[EN] Enable/disable default CSS formatter.
[EN] Separate selectors with a new line.
[EN] Separate rulesets by a blank line.
[EN] Ensure a space character around selector separators '>', '+', '~' (e.g. `a > b`).
[EN] Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).
[EN] Whether existing line breaks before rules and declarations should be preserved.
[EN] Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk, when `#css.format.preserveNewLines#` is enabled.
[EN] By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.
[EN] Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.

[EN] Do not use empty rulesets.

[EN] Hex colors must consist of 3, 4, 6 or 8 hex numbers.
[EN] Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.
[EN] IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.
[EN] Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.
[EN] Import statements do not load in parallel.

[EN] When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.

[EN] Enables or disables all validations.
[EN] Show property and value documentation in LESS hovers.
[EN] Show references to MDN in LESS hovers.
[EN] Enable/disable default LESS formatter.
[EN] Separate selectors with a new line.
[EN] Separate rulesets by a blank line.

[EN] Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).
[EN] Whether existing line breaks before rules and declarations should be preserved.
[EN] Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk, when `#less.format.preserveNewLines#` is enabled.

[EN] Show references to MDN in SCSS hovers.
[EN] Enable/disable default SCSS formatter.
[EN] Separate selectors with a new line.
[EN] Separate rulesets by a blank line.
[EN] Ensure a space character around selector separators '>', '+', '~' (e.g. `a > b`).
[EN] Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).
[EN] Whether existing line breaks before rules and declarations should be preserved.
[EN] Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk, when `#scss.format.preserveNewLines#` is enabled.
[EN] The setting `css.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.
[EN] The setting `scss.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.
[EN] The setting `less.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.
[EN] Toggle Auto Attach
[EN] Define profile for specified syntax or use your own profile with specific rules.
[EN] An array of languages where Emmet abbreviations should not be expanded.

[EN] An array of paths, where each path can contain Emmet syntaxProfiles and/or snippet files.
In case of conflicts, the profiles/snippets of later paths will override those of earlier paths.
See https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/emmet for more information and an example snippet file.
[EN] A path containing Emmet syntaxProfiles and/or snippets.

[EN] Shows expanded Emmet abbreviations as suggestions.
The option `"inMarkupAndStylesheetFilesOnly"` applies to html, haml, jade, slim, xml, xsl, css, scss, sass, less and stylus.
The option `"always"` applies to all parts of the file regardless of markup/css.
[EN] Shows possible Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. Not applicable in stylesheets or when emmet.showExpandedAbbreviation is set to `"never"`.

[EN] Enable Emmet abbreviations in languages that are not supported by default. Add a mapping here between the language and Emmet supported language.
 For example: `{"vue-html": "html", "javascript": "javascriptreact"}`
[EN] Variables to be used in Emmet snippets.
[EN] When enabled, Emmet abbreviations are expanded when pressing TAB, even when completions do not show up. When disabled, completions that show up can still be accepted by pressing TAB.
[EN] Preferences used to modify behavior of some actions and resolvers of Emmet.
[EN] Default unit for integer values.
[EN] Default unit for float values.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files.
[EN] Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files.
[EN] If `true`, then Emmet suggestions will show up as snippets allowing you to order them as per `#editor.snippetSuggestions#` setting.
[EN] Element separator used for classes when using the BEM filter.
[EN] Modifier separator used for classes when using the BEM filter.
[EN] A definition of comment that should be placed before matched element when comment filter is applied.
[EN] A definition of comment that should be placed after matched element when comment filter is applied.
[EN] A comma-separated list of attribute names that should exist in the abbreviation for the comment filter to be applied.
[EN] An array of tag names that should never get inner indentation.
[EN] An array of tag names that should always get inner indentation.
[EN] If `true`, compact notation of boolean attributes are produced.
[EN] Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'webkit' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'webkit' prefix.
[EN] Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'moz' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'moz' prefix.
[EN] Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'o' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'o' prefix.
[EN] Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'ms' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'ms' prefix.
[EN] The minimum score (from 0 to 1) that fuzzy-matched abbreviation should achieve. Lower values may produce many false-positive matches, higher values may reduce possible matches.

[EN] When set to `false`, the whole file is parsed to determine if current position is valid for expanding Emmet abbreviations. When set to `true`, only the content around the current position in CSS/SCSS/Less files is parsed.
[EN] The number of sibling inline elements needed for line breaks to be placed between those elements. If `0`, inline elements are always expanded onto a single line.
[EN] If `true`, reverses attribute merging directions when resolving snippets.

[EN] Style of self-closing tags: html (`
`), xml (`
`) or xhtml (`
`).
[EN] If `true`, color values like `#f` will be expanded to `#fff` instead of `#ffffff`.

[EN] If `true`, Emmet will use inline completions to suggest expansions. To prevent the non-inline completion item provider from showing up as often while this setting is `true`, turn `#editor.quickSuggestions#` to `inline` or `off` for the `other` item.

[EN] Whether Git is enabled.
[EN] Path and filename of the git executable, e.g. `C:\Program Files\Git\bin\git.exe` (Windows). This can also be an array of string values containing multiple paths to look up.
[EN] Configures when repositories should be automatically detected.
[EN] Scan for both subfolders of the current opened folder and parent folders of open files.
[EN] Disable automatic repository scanning.
[EN] Scan for subfolders of the currently opened folder.
[EN] Scan for parent folders of open files.
[EN] Whether auto refreshing is enabled.
[EN] When set to true, commits will automatically be fetched from the default remote of the current Git repository. Setting to `all` will fetch from all remotes.
[EN] Duration in seconds between each automatic git fetch, when `#git.autofetch#` is enabled.
[EN] Confirm before synchronizing Git repositories.
[EN] Controls the Git count badge.
[EN] Count all changes.
[EN] Count only tracked changes.
[EN] Turn off counter.
[EN] Controls what type of Git refs are listed when running `Checkout to...`.
[EN] Local branches
[EN] Tags
[EN] Remote branches

[EN] The name of the default branch (example: main, trunk, development) when initializing a new Git repository. When set to empty, the default branch name configured in Git will be used. **Note:** Requires Git version `2.28.0` or later.
[EN] Prefix used when creating a new branch.
[EN] List of protected branches. By default, a prompt is shown before changes are committed to a protected branch. The prompt can be controlled using the `#git.branchProtectionPrompt#`  setting.
[EN] Controls whether a prompt is being shown before changes are committed to a protected branch.
[EN] Always commit changes to the protected branch.
[EN] Always commit changes to a new branch.
[EN] Always prompt before changes are committed to a protected branch.

[EN] List of dictionaries used for the randomly generated branch name. Each value represents the dictionary used to generate the segment of the branch name. Supported dictionaries: `adjectives`, `animals`, `colors` and `numbers`.
[EN] A random adjective
[EN] A random animal name
[EN] A random color name
[EN] A random number between 100 and 999
[EN] Controls whether a random name is generated when creating a new branch.
[EN] A regular expression to validate new branch names.
[EN] The character to replace whitespace in new branch names, and to separate segments of a randomly generated branch name.
[EN] Ignores the legacy Git warning.
[EN] Ignores the warning when Git is missing.
[EN] Ignores the warning when Git 2.25 - 2.26 is installed on Windows.
[EN] Ignores the warning when there are too many changes in a repository.
[EN] Ignores the warning when it looks like the branch might have been rebased when pulling.
[EN] The default location to clone a Git repository.
[EN] Controls whether a full text editor will be used to author commit messages, whenever no message is provided in the commit input box.
[EN] Enable verbose output when `#git.useEditorAsCommitInput#` is enabled.
[EN] Commit all changes when there are no staged changes.
[EN] Control which changes are automatically staged by Smart Commit.
[EN] Automatically stage all changes.
[EN] Automatically stage tracked changes only.
[EN] Suggests to enable smart commit (commit all changes when there are no staged changes).
[EN] Enables commit signing with GPG, X.509, or SSH.

[EN] Controls what changes are discarded by the `Discard all changes` command. `all` discards all changes. `tracked` discards only tracked files. `prompt` shows a prompt dialog every time the action is run.
[EN] Controls whether Git contributes colors and badges to the Explorer and the Open Editors view.
[EN] Controls whether the Git Sync command appears in the status bar.
[EN] Push all annotated tags when running the sync command.
[EN] Automatically replace the local tags with the remote tags in case of a conflict when running the pull command.
[EN] Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before stashing changes.
[EN] Check for any unsaved files.
[EN] Check only for unsaved staged files.
[EN] Disable this check.
[EN] Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before committing.
[EN] Check for any unsaved files.
[EN] Check only for unsaved staged files.
[EN] Disable this check.
[EN] Run a git command after a successful commit.
[EN] Don't run any command after a commit.
[EN] Run 'git push' after a successful commit.
[EN] Run 'git pull' and 'git push' after a successful commit.
[EN] Remember the last git command that ran after a commit.
[EN] Controls whether to open a repository automatically after cloning.
[EN] Always open in current window.
[EN] Always open in a new window.
[EN] Only open in current window when no folder is opened.
[EN] Always prompt for action.
[EN] Controls whether to show an inline Open File action in the Git changes view.
[EN] Controls whether to show a notification when a push is successful.
[EN] Controls whether to show commit message input validation diagnostics.
[EN] Controls the commit message length threshold for showing a warning.
[EN] Controls the commit message subject length threshold for showing a warning. Unset it to inherit the value of `#git.inputValidationLength#`.
[EN] Controls whether to automatically detect Git submodules.
[EN] Controls the limit of Git submodules detected.
[EN] Controls whether to automatically detect Git worktrees.
[EN] Controls the limit of Git worktrees detected.
[EN] Always show the Staged Changes resource group.
[EN] Controls the signoff flag for all commits.
[EN] Ignore modifications to submodules in the file tree.
[EN] List of Git repositories to ignore.
[EN] List of paths to search for Git repositories in.
[EN] Controls whether Git actions should show progress.
[EN] Force Git to use rebase when running the sync command.
[EN] Always confirm the creation of empty commits for the 'Git: Commit Empty' command.
[EN] When enabled, fetch all branches when pulling. Otherwise, fetch just the current one.
[EN] Controls whether a branch that does not have outgoing commits is fast-forwarded before it is checked out.
[EN] Fetch all tags when pulling.
[EN] Prune when fetching.
[EN] Stash any changes before pulling and restore them after successful pull.
[EN] Controls whether force push (with or without lease) is enabled.
[EN] Controls whether force pushing uses the safer force-with-lease variant.
[EN] Controls whether force pushing uses the safer force-if-includes variant. Note: This setting requires the `#git.useForcePushWithLease#` setting to be enabled, and Git version `2.30.0` or later.
[EN] Controls whether to ask for confirmation before force-pushing.
[EN] Controls whether commits without running pre-commit and commit-msg hooks are allowed.
[EN] Controls whether to ask for confirmation before committing without verification.
[EN] Controls whether the diff editor should be automatically closed when changes are stashed, committed, discarded, staged, or unstaged.
[EN] Controls whether the diff editor should be opened when clicking a change. Otherwise the regular editor will be opened.
[EN] Controls whether a notification comes up when running the Sync action, which allows the user to cancel the operation.
[EN] Controls the sort order for branches.
[EN] Controls how untracked changes behave.
[EN] All changes, tracked and untracked, appear together and behave equally.
[EN] Untracked changes appear separately in the Source Control view. They are also excluded from several actions.
[EN] Untracked changes are hidden and excluded from several actions.
[EN] Controls whether to require explicit Git user configuration or allow Git to guess if missing.
[EN] Controls whether to show the commit input in the Git source control panel.

[EN] Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the authentication handler for Git processes spawned in the Integrated Terminal. Note: Terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.
[EN] Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the Git editor for Git processes spawned in the integrated terminal. Note: Terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.
[EN] Controls whether to show the commit author in the Timeline view.
[EN] Controls whether to show uncommitted changes in the Timeline view.
[EN] Controls which date to use for items in the Timeline view.
[EN] Use the committed date
[EN] Use the authored date
[EN] Controls whether to use the message from the commit input box as the default stash message.
[EN] Controls whether an action button is shown in the Source Control view.
[EN] Show an action button to commit changes when the local branch has modified files ready to be committed.
[EN] Show an action button to publish the local branch when it does not have a tracking remote branch.
[EN] Show an action button to synchronize changes when the local branch is either ahead or behind the remote branch.
[EN] Controls how to limit the number of changes that can be parsed from Git status command. Can be set to 0 for no limit.
[EN] Experimental improvements for the Git setup flow.
[EN] List of folders that are ignored while scanning for Git repositories when `#git.autoRepositoryDetection#` is set to `true` or `subFolders`.
[EN] Controls the depth used when scanning workspace folders for Git repositories when `#git.autoRepositoryDetection#` is set to `true` or `subFolders`. Can be set to `-1` for no limit.
[EN] Controls whether GIT_ASKPASS should be overwritten to use the integrated version.
[EN] Open the merge editor for files that are currently under conflict.
[EN] Controls whether to optimistically update the state of the Source Control view after running git commands.
[EN] Control whether a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files should be opened.
[EN] Always open a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files.
[EN] Never open a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files.
[EN] Prompt before opening a repository the parent folders of workspaces or open files.
[EN] Controls whether to publish unpublished Git state when using Continue Working On from a Git repository.
[EN] Always publish unpublished Git state when using Continue Working On from a Git repository
[EN] Never publish unpublished Git state when using Continue Working On from a Git repository
[EN] Prompt to publish unpublished Git state when using Continue Working On from a Git repository

[EN] Controls the threshold of the similarity index (the amount of additions/deletions compared to the file's size) for changes in a pair of added/deleted files to be considered a rename. **Note:** Requires Git version `2.18.0` or later.
[EN] Controls whether to show blame information in the editor using editor decorations.

[EN] Template for the blame information editor decoration. Supported variables:

* `hash`: Commit hash

* `hashShort`: First N characters of the commit hash according to `#git.commitShortHashLength#`

* `subject`: First line of the commit message

* `authorName`: Author name

* `authorEmail`: Author email

* `authorDate`: Author date

* `authorDateAgo`: Time difference between now and the author date
[EN] Controls whether to show blame information in the status bar.

[EN] Template for the blame information status bar item. Supported variables:

* `hash`: Commit hash

* `hashShort`: First N characters of the commit hash according to `#git.commitShortHashLength#`

* `subject`: First line of the commit message

* `authorName`: Author name

* `authorEmail`: Author email

* `authorDate`: Author date

* `authorDateAgo`: Time difference between now and the author date
[EN] Controls the length of the commit short hash.
[EN] Controls whether to check for unresolved diagnostics before committing.

[EN] Controls the list of sources (**Item**) and the minimum severity (**Value**) to be considered before committing. **Note:** To ignore diagnostics from a particular source, add the source to the list and set the minimum severity to `none`.

[EN] Controls whether discarding untracked changes moves the file(s) to the Recycle Bin (Windows), Trash (macOS, Linux) instead of deleting them permanently. **Note:** This setting has no effect when connected to a remote or when running in Linux as a snap package.
[EN] Controls whether to show the details of the last commit for Git refs in the checkout, branch, and tag pickers.
[EN] Git
[EN] Commit
[EN] Amend
[EN] Sign Off
[EN] Changes
[EN] Pull, Push
[EN] Branch
[EN] Remote
[EN] Stash
[EN] Tags
[EN] Worktrees
[EN] Color for added resources.
[EN] Color for modified resources.
[EN] Color for modified resources which have been staged.
[EN] Color for deleted resources which have been staged.
[EN] Color for deleted resources.
[EN] Color for renamed or copied resources.
[EN] Color for untracked resources.
[EN] Color for ignored resources.
[EN] Color for resources with conflicts.
[EN] Color for submodule resources.
[EN] Color for added incoming resource.
[EN] Color for deleted incoming resource.
[EN] Color for renamed incoming resource.
[EN] Color for modified incoming resource.
[EN] Color for the blame editor decoration.
[EN] To learn more about how to use Git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).

[EN] Controls whether to query repository rules for GitHub repositories
[EN] Controls whether to enable automatic GitHub authentication for git commands within VS Code.
[EN] Controls which protocol is used to clone a GitHub repository
[EN] Controls whether to show the GitHub avatar of the commit author in various hovers (ex: Git blame, Timeline, Source Control Graph, etc.)
[EN] Controls enablement of Grunt task detection. Grunt task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.
[EN] Controls enablement of Gulp task detection. Gulp task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.

[EN] A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-html-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its HTML support for the custom HTML tags, attributes and attribute values you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.
[EN] Enable/disable default HTML formatter.
[EN] Maximum amount of characters per line (0 = disable).
[EN] List of tags, comma separated, that shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to all tags listed at https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#phrasing-content.
[EN] List of tags, comma separated, where the content shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to the `pre` tag.
[EN] Indent `<head>` and `<body>` sections.
[EN] Controls whether existing line breaks before elements should be preserved. Only works before elements, not inside tags or for text.
[EN] Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk. Use `null` for unlimited.
[EN] Format and indent `{{#foo}}` and `{{/foo}}`.
[EN] List of tags, comma separated, that should have an extra newline before them. `null` defaults to `"head, body, /html"`.
[EN] Wrap attributes.
[EN] Wrap attributes only when line length is exceeded.
[EN] Wrap each attribute except first.
[EN] Wrap each attribute except first and keep aligned.
[EN] Wrap each attribute.
[EN] Wrap when line length is exceeded, align attributes vertically.
[EN] Preserve wrapping of attributes.
[EN] Preserve wrapping of attributes but align.
[EN] Honor django, erb, handlebars and php templating language tags.
[EN] Keep text content together between this string.
[EN] Indent wrapped attributes to after N characters. Use `null` to use the default indent size. Ignored if `#html.format.wrapAttributes#` is set to `aligned`.
[EN] Controls whether the built-in HTML language support suggests HTML5 tags, properties and values.
[EN] Controls whether the built-in HTML language support suggests closing tags. When disabled, end tag completions like `` will not be shown.
[EN] Traces the communication between VS Code and the HTML language server.
[EN] Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded scripts.
[EN] Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded styles.
[EN] Enable/disable auto creation of quotes for HTML attribute assignment. The type of quotes can be configured by `#html.completion.attributeDefaultValue#`.
[EN] Enable/disable autoclosing of HTML tags.
[EN] Controls the default value for attributes when completion is accepted.
[EN] Attribute value is set to "".
[EN] Attribute value is set to ''.
[EN] Attribute value is not set.
[EN] Enable/disable mirroring cursor on matching HTML tag.
[EN] Deprecated in favor of `editor.linkedEditing`
[EN] Show tag and attribute documentation in hover.
[EN] Show references to MDN in hover.
[EN] Enable/disable pasting of images into Markdown cells in ipynb notebook files. Pasted images are inserted as attachments to the cell.
[EN] Experimental feature to serialize the Jupyter notebook in a worker thread.
[EN] Controls enablement of Jake task detection. Jake task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.
[EN] Associate schemas to JSON files in the current project.
[EN] A URL or absolute file path to a schema. Can be a relative path (starting with './') in workspace and workspace folder settings.

[EN] An array of file patterns to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas. `*` and '**' can be used as a wildcard. Exclusion patterns can also be defined and start with '!'. A file matches when there is at least one matching pattern and the last matching pattern is not an exclusion pattern.
[EN] A file pattern that can contain '*' and '**' to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas. When beginning with '!', it defines an exclusion pattern.
[EN] The schema definition for the given URL. The schema only needs to be provided to avoid accesses to the schema URL.
[EN] Enable/disable default JSON formatter
[EN] Keep all existing new lines when formatting.
[EN] Enable/disable JSON validation.
[EN] Traces the communication between VS Code and the JSON language server.
[EN] Enables or disables color decorators
[EN] The setting `json.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.
[EN] Unable to resolve schema.
[EN] Click to retry.
[EN] The maximum number of outline symbols and folding regions computed (limited for performance reasons).
[EN] Show notification when exceeding the maximum number of outline symbols and folding regions.
[EN] When enabled, JSON schemas can be fetched from http and https locations.
[EN] Clear Schema Cache
[EN] Sort Document
[EN] The extension requires workspace trust to load schemas from http and https.

[EN] Sets how line-breaks are rendered in the Markdown preview. Setting it to `true` creates a `
` for newlines inside paragraphs.
[EN] Convert URL-like text to links in the Markdown preview.
[EN] Enable some language-neutral replacement and quotes beautification in the Markdown preview.
[EN] Double-click in the Markdown preview to switch to the editor.
[EN] Controls the font family used in the Markdown preview.
[EN] Controls the font size in pixels used in the Markdown preview.
[EN] Controls the line height used in the Markdown preview. This number is relative to the font size.
[EN] Mark the current editor selection in the Markdown preview.
[EN] When a Markdown preview is scrolled, update the view of the editor.
[EN] When a Markdown editor is scrolled, update the view of the preview.

[EN] A list of URLs or local paths to CSS style sheets to use from the Markdown preview. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the folder open in the Explorer. If there is no open folder, they are interpreted relative to the location of the Markdown file. All '\' need to be written as '\\'.
[EN] Enable debug logging for the Markdown extension.
[EN] Traces the communication between VS Code and the Markdown language server.
[EN] Controls the logging level of the Markdown language server.
[EN] Find File References
[EN] Insert Link to File in Workspace
[EN] Insert Image from Workspace
[EN] Try to open links in the editor.
[EN] Try to open links in the Markdown preview.
[EN] Open links in the active editor group.
[EN] Open links beside the active editor.

[EN] Enable suggestions for headers in other Markdown files in the current workspace. Accepting one of these suggestions inserts the full path to header in that file, for example: `[link text](/path/to/file.md#header)`.
[EN] Disable workspace header suggestions.
[EN] Enable workspace header suggestions after typing `##` in a path, for example: `[link text](##`.
[EN] Enable workspace header suggestions after typing either `##` or `#` in a path, for example: `[link text](#` or `[link text](##`.
[EN] Enable dropping files into a Markdown editor while holding Shift. Requires enabling `#editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled#`.
[EN] Always insert Markdown links.
[EN] Smartly create Markdown links by default when not dropping into a code block or other special element. Use the drop widget to switch between pasting as plain text or as Markdown links.
[EN] Never create Markdown links.

[EN] Controls if files outside of the workspace that are dropped into a Markdown editor should be copied into the workspace.

Use `#markdown.copyFiles.destination#` to configure where copied dropped files should be created
[EN] Enable pasting files into a Markdown editor to create Markdown links. Requires enabling `#editor.pasteAs.enabled#`.
[EN] Always insert Markdown links.
[EN] Smartly create Markdown links by default when not pasting into a code block or other special element. Use the paste widget to switch between pasting as plain text or as Markdown links.
[EN] Never create Markdown links.

[EN] Controls if files outside of the workspace that are pasted into a Markdown editor should be copied into the workspace.

Use `#markdown.copyFiles.destination#` to configure where copied files should be created.
[EN] Try to copy external image and video files into the workspace.
[EN] Do not copy external files into the workspace.
[EN] Controls if Markdown links are created when URLs are pasted into a Markdown editor. Requires enabling `#editor.pasteAs.enabled#`.
[EN] Always insert Markdown links.
[EN] Smartly create Markdown links by default when not pasting into a code block or other special element. Use the paste widget to switch between pasting as plain text or as Markdown links.

[EN] Smartly create Markdown links by default when you have selected text and are not pasting into a code block or other special element. Use the paste widget to switch between pasting as plain text or as Markdown links.
[EN] Never create Markdown links.
[EN] Try to update links in Markdown files when a file is renamed/moved in the workspace. Use `#markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.include#` to configure which files trigger link updates.
[EN] Prompt on each file move.
[EN] Always update links automatically.
[EN] Never try to update link and don't prompt.
[EN] Glob patterns that specifies files that trigger automatic link updates. See `#markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.enabled#` for details about this feature.
[EN] The glob pattern to match file paths against. Set to true to enable the pattern.
[EN] Enable updating links when a directory is moved or renamed in the workspace.
[EN] Enable highlighting link occurrences in the current document.
[EN] Controls if files created by drop or paste should overwrite existing files.
[EN] If a file with the same name already exists, append a number to the file name, for example: `image.png` becomes `image-1.png`.
[EN] If a file with the same name already exists, overwrite it.
[EN] Controls if file extensions (for example `.md`) are added or not for links to Markdown files. This setting is used when file paths are added by tooling such as path completions or file renames.
[EN] For existing paths, try to maintain the file extension style. For new paths, add file extensions.
[EN] Prefer including the file extension. For example, path completions to a file named `file.md` will insert `file.md`.
[EN] Prefer removing the file extension. For example, path completions to a file named `file.md` will insert `file` without the `.md`.

[EN] Snippet used when adding videos to Markdown. This snippet can use the following variables:
- `${src}` — The resolved path of the video file.
- `${title}` — The title used for the video. A snippet placeholder will automatically be created for this variable.

[EN] Snippet used when adding audio to Markdown. This snippet can use the following variables:
- `${src}` — The resolved path of the audio  file.
- `${title}` — The title used for the audio. A snippet placeholder will automatically be created for this variable.

[EN] Enable/disable a paste option that updates links and reference in text that is copied and pasted between Markdown editors.

To use this feature, after pasting text that contains updatable links, just click on the Paste Widget and select `Paste and update pasted links`.
[EN] Required for loading styles configured in the workspace.
[EN] Enable/disable rendering math in the built-in Markdown preview.
[EN] A collection of custom macros. Each macro is a key-value pair where the key is a new command name and the value is the expansion of the macro.
[EN] Whether to automatically navigate to the next merge conflict after resolving a merge conflict.
[EN] Create a CodeLens for merge conflict blocks within editor.
[EN] Create decorators for merge conflict blocks within editor.

[EN] Sign Out

[EN] Complete functions with their parameter signature.
[EN] Enable/disable showing completions on potentially undefined values that insert an optional chain call. Requires strict null checks to be enabled.
[EN] Enable/disable auto-import-style completions on partially-typed import statements.

[EN] Disables TypeScript and JavaScript language features to allow usage of the TypeScript Go experimental extension. Requires TypeScript Go to be installed and configured. Requires reloading extensions after changing this setting.

[EN] Specifies the folder path to the tsserver and `lib*.d.ts` files under a TypeScript install to use for IntelliSense, for example: `./node_modules/typescript/lib`.

- When specified as a user setting, the TypeScript version from `typescript.tsdk` automatically replaces the built-in TypeScript version.
- When specified as a workspace setting, `typescript.tsdk` allows you to switch to use that workspace version of TypeScript for IntelliSense with the `TypeScript: Select TypeScript version` command.

See the [TypeScript documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/typescript/typescript-compiling#_using-newer-typescript-versions) for more detail about managing TypeScript versions.

[EN] Disables [automatic type acquisition](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript#_typings-and-automatic-type-acquisition). Automatic type acquisition fetches `@types` packages from npm to improve IntelliSense for external libraries.
[EN] Enables prompting of users to use the TypeScript version configured in the workspace for Intellisense.

[EN] Enables tracing TS server performance to a directory. These trace files can be used to diagnose TS Server performance issues. The log may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.

[EN] Enables logging of the TS server to a file. This log can be used to diagnose TS Server issues. The log may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.
[EN] Additional paths to discover TypeScript Language Service plugins.
[EN] Either an absolute or relative path. Relative path will be resolved against workspace folder(s).

[EN] Enables tracing of messages sent to the TS server. This trace can be used to diagnose TS Server issues. The trace may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.
[EN] Enables region-based diagnostics in TypeScript. Requires using TypeScript 5.6+ in the workspace.
[EN] Enable/disable TypeScript validation.
[EN] Enable/disable default TypeScript formatter.
[EN] Enable/disable default JavaScript formatter.
[EN] Defines space handling after a comma delimiter.
[EN] Defines space handling after the constructor keyword.
[EN] Defines space handling after a semicolon in a for statement.
[EN] Defines space handling after a binary operator.
[EN] Defines space handling after keywords in a control flow statement.
[EN] Defines space handling after function keyword for anonymous functions.
[EN] Defines space handling before function argument parentheses.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty parenthesis.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty brackets.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty braces.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing empty braces.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing template string braces.
[EN] Defines space handling after opening and before closing JSX expression braces.
[EN] Defines space handling after type assertions in TypeScript.
[EN] Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for functions or not.
[EN] Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for control blocks or not.
[EN] Defines handling of optional semicolons.
[EN] Don't insert or remove any semicolons.
[EN] Insert semicolons at statement ends.
[EN] Remove unnecessary semicolons.
[EN] Indent case clauses in switch statements. Requires using TypeScript 5.1+ in the workspace.
[EN] Enable/disable JavaScript validation.
[EN] Enable/disable references CodeLens in JavaScript files.
[EN] Enable/disable references CodeLens on all functions in JavaScript files.
[EN] Enable/disable references CodeLens in TypeScript files.
[EN] Enable/disable references CodeLens on all functions in TypeScript files.
[EN] Enable/disable implementations CodeLens. This CodeLens shows the implementers of an interface.
[EN] Enable/disable implementations CodeLens on interface methods.
[EN] Enable/disable showing implementations CodeLens above all class methods instead of only on abstract methods.
[EN] Restart TS Server
[EN] Report style checks as warnings.
[EN] Specifies the path to the npm executable used for [Automatic Type Acquisition](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript#_typings-and-automatic-type-acquisition).
[EN] Check if npm is installed for [Automatic Type Acquisition](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript#_typings-and-automatic-type-acquisition).

[EN] Enable/disable including unique names from the file in JavaScript suggestions. Note that name suggestions are always disabled in JavaScript code that is semantically checked using `@ts-check` or `checkJs`.
[EN] Controls auto detection of tsc tasks.
[EN] Disable this feature.
[EN] Create both build and watch tasks.
[EN] Only create single run compile tasks.
[EN] Only create compile and watch tasks.
[EN] TypeScript problems
[EN] TypeScript problems (watch mode)
[EN] TypeScript problems (watch mode)
[EN] Enable/disable suggestions for paths in import statements and require calls.
[EN] Enable/disable spawning a separate TypeScript server that can more quickly respond to syntax related operations, such as calculating folding or computing document symbols.
[EN] Controls if TypeScript launches a dedicated server to more quickly handle syntax related operations, such as computing code folding.
[EN] Use a lighter weight syntax server to handle all IntelliSense operations. This syntax server can only provide IntelliSense for opened files.
[EN] Don't use a dedicated syntax server. Use a single server to handle all IntelliSense operations.
[EN] Spawn both a full server and a lighter weight server dedicated to syntax operations. The syntax server is used to speed up syntax operations and provide IntelliSense while projects are loading.

[EN] The maximum amount of memory (in MB) to allocate to the TypeScript server process. To use a memory limit greater than 4 GB, use `#typescript.tsserver.nodePath#` to run TS Server with a custom Node installation.
[EN] Enables project wide error reporting.
[EN] Sets the locale used to report JavaScript and TypeScript errors. Defaults to use VS Code's locale.
[EN] Use VS Code's configured display language.
[EN] Sets the module system for the program. See more: https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#module.
[EN] Set target JavaScript language version for emitted JavaScript and include library declarations. See more: https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#target.
[EN] Enable/disable semantic checking of JavaScript files. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
[EN] Enable/disable `experimentalDecorators` in JavaScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

[EN] Enable/disable [strict null checks](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictNullChecks) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

[EN] Enable/disable [strict function types](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictFunctionTypes) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

[EN] Enable/disable [strict mode](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strict) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
[EN] Enable/disable generating `@returns` annotations for JSDoc templates.
[EN] Enable/disable auto import suggestions.
[EN] Makes `Go to Definition` avoid type declaration files when possible by triggering `Go to Source Definition` instead. This allows `Go to Source Definition` to be triggered with the mouse gesture.
[EN] Disable parameter name hints.
[EN] Enable parameter name hints only for literal arguments.
[EN] Enable parameter name hints for literal and non-literal arguments.
[EN] Suppress parameter name hints on arguments whose text is identical to the parameter name.
[EN] Suppress type hints on variables whose name is identical to the type name.
[EN] Enable/disable suggestion diagnostics for JavaScript files in the editor.
[EN] Enable/disable suggestion diagnostics for TypeScript files in the editor.
[EN] Preferred quote style to use for Quick Fixes.
[EN] Always use single quotes: `'`
[EN] Always use double quotes: `"`
[EN] Infer quote type from existing code
[EN] Preferred path style for auto imports.
[EN] Prefers a non-relative import only if one is available that has fewer path segments than a relative import.
[EN] Prefers a relative path to the imported file location.
[EN] Prefers a non-relative import based on the `baseUrl` or `paths` configured in your `jsconfig.json` / `tsconfig.json`.
[EN] Prefers a non-relative import only if the relative import path would leave the package or project directory.
[EN] Preferred path ending for auto imports.
[EN] .js / .ts
[EN] Use project settings to select a default.
[EN] Shorten `./component/index.js` to `./component`.
[EN] Shorten `./component/index.js` to `./component/index`.
[EN] Do not shorten path endings; include the `.js` or `.ts` extension.
[EN] Preferred style for JSX attribute completions.
[EN] Insert `={}` or `=""` after attribute names based on the prop type. See `#javascript.preferences.quoteStyle#` to control the type of quotes used for string attributes.
[EN] Insert `={}` or `=""` after attribute names based on the prop type. See `#typescript.preferences.quoteStyle#` to control the type of quotes used for string attributes.
[EN] Insert `={}` after attribute names.
[EN] Only insert attribute names.
[EN] Enable/disable searching `package.json` dependencies for available auto imports.
[EN] Search dependencies based on estimated performance impact.
[EN] Always search dependencies.
[EN] Never search dependencies.

[EN] Specify glob patterns of files to exclude from auto imports. Relative paths are resolved relative to the workspace root. Patterns are evaluated using tsconfig.json [`exclude`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#exclude) semantics.

[EN] Specify regular expressions to exclude auto imports with matching import specifiers. Examples:

- `^node:`
- `lib/internal` (slashes don't need to be escaped...)
- `/lib\/internal/i` (...unless including surrounding slashes for `i` or `u` flags)
- `^lodash$` (only allow subpath imports from lodash)
[EN] Include the `type` keyword in auto-imports whenever possible. Requires using TypeScript 5.3+ in the workspace.
[EN] Exclude symbols that come from library files in `Go to Symbol in Workspace` results. Requires using TypeScript 5.3+ in the workspace.
[EN] Enable/disable automatic updating of import paths when you rename or move a file in VS Code.
[EN] Prompt on each rename.
[EN] Always update paths automatically.
[EN] Never rename paths and don't prompt.
[EN] Enable/disable automatic closing of JSX tags.
[EN] Enable/disable autocomplete suggestions.
[EN] Enable/disable suggestion to complete JSDoc comments.
[EN] Use VS Code's file watchers instead of TypeScript's. Requires using TypeScript 5.4+ in the workspace.
[EN] Configure which watching strategies should be used to keep track of files and directories.
[EN] Use VS Code's file watchers instead of TypeScript's. Requires using TypeScript 5.4+ in the workspace.
[EN] Strategy for how individual files are watched.
[EN] Polls files in chunks at regular interval.
[EN] Check every file for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
[EN] Check every file for changes several times a second, but use heuristics to check certain types of files less frequently than others.
[EN] Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified files will be checked less often.
[EN] Attempt to use the operating system/file system's native events for file changes.
[EN] Attempt to use the operating system/file system's native events to listen for changes on a file's containing directories. This can use fewer file watchers, but might be less accurate.
[EN] Strategy for how entire directory trees are watched under systems that lack recursive file-watching functionality.
[EN] Polls directories in chunks at regular interval.
[EN] Check every directory for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
[EN] Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified directories will be checked less often.
[EN] Attempt to use the operating system/file system's native events for directory changes.
[EN] When using file system events, this option specifies the polling strategy that gets used when the system runs out of native file watchers and/or doesn't support native file watchers.
[EN] Check every file for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
[EN] Check every file for changes several times a second, but use heuristics to check certain types of files less frequently than others.
[EN] Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified files will be checked less often.

[EN] Disable deferred watching on directories. Deferred watching is useful when lots of file changes might occur at once (e.g. a change in node_modules from running npm install), but you might want to disable it with this flag for some less-common setups.
[EN] Enable/disable introducing aliases for object shorthand properties during renames.
[EN] When on a JSX tag, try to rename the matching tag instead of renaming the symbol. Requires using TypeScript 5.1+ in the workspace.
[EN] Advanced preferences that control how imports are ordered.
[EN] Advanced preferences that control how imports are ordered.
[EN] Specifies how imports should be sorted with regards to case-sensitivity. If `auto` or unspecified, we will detect the case-sensitivity per file
[EN] Detect case-sensitivity for import sorting.
[EN] Sort imports case-insensitively.
[EN] Sort imports case-sensitively.
[EN] Specify how type-only named imports should be sorted.
[EN] Detect where type-only named imports should be sorted.
[EN] Type only named imports are sorted to the end of the import list. E.g. `import { B, Z, type A, type Y } from 'module';`
[EN] Named imports are sorted by name only. E.g. `import { type A, B, type Y, Z } from 'module';`
[EN] Type only named imports are sorted to the beginning of the import list. E.g. `import { type A, type Y, B, Z } from 'module';`
[EN] Specify whether to sort imports using Unicode or Ordinal collation.
[EN] Sort imports using the numeric value of each code point.
[EN] Sort imports using the Unicode code collation.
[EN] Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Overrides the locale used for collation. Specify `auto` to use the UI locale.
[EN] Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`, and `organizeImports.caseSensitivity` is not `caseInsensitive`. Indicates whether upper-case will sort before lower-case.
[EN] Default order given by `locale`.
[EN] Lower-case comes before upper-case. E.g.` a, A, z, Z`.
[EN] Upper-case comes before lower-case. E.g. ` A, a, B, b`.
[EN] Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Sort numeric strings by integer value.
[EN] Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Compare characters with diacritical marks as unequal to base character.
[EN] Controls which files are searched by [Go to Symbol in Workspace](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_open-symbol-by-name).
[EN] Search all open JavaScript or TypeScript projects for symbols.
[EN] Only search for symbols in the current JavaScript or TypeScript project.
[EN] Sort Imports
[EN] Remove Unused Imports
[EN] Find File References
[EN] Go to Source Definition
[EN] Enable/disable snippet completions for class members.
[EN] Enable/disable snippet completions for methods in object literals.
[EN] Enable/disable project-wide IntelliSense on web. Requires that VS Code is running in a trusted context.

[EN] Suppresses semantic errors on web even when project wide IntelliSense is enabled. This is always on when project wide IntelliSense is not enabled or available. See `#typescript.tsserver.web.projectWideIntellisense.enabled#`

[EN] Enable/disable package acquisition on the web. This enables IntelliSense for imported packages. Requires `#typescript.tsserver.web.projectWideIntellisense.enabled#`. Currently not supported for Safari.
[EN] Run TS Server on a custom Node installation. This can be a path to a Node executable, or 'node' if you want VS Code to detect a Node installation.
[EN] Automatically update imports when pasting code. Requires TypeScript 5.6+.
[EN] The maximum number of characters in a hover. If the hover is longer than this, it will be truncated. Requires TypeScript 5.9+.
[EN] Debug and run your JavaScript code in Node.js with Visual Studio Code.
[EN] Learn more about JavaScript and Node.js in Visual Studio Code.
